ARABIC: وَجَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ فِرْعَوْنَ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَٰلِبِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The magicians came to Pharaoh and they asked, 'Will we receive a reward if we are the winners?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The magicians came to the Pharaoh and said: "Is there reward for us if we succeed?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And the magicians came to Pharaoh and said: 'Shall we have a reward if we win?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The magicians came to the Pharaoh and said, "We must have our reward if we are to gain a victory over him (Moses)".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the magicians came to Firaun, and said, “Will we get some reward if we are victorious?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And so the sorcerers came to Fir`awn. They said: "Indeed there will be a (good) reward for us if we are the victors."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the enchanters came to Firon (and) said: We must surely have a reward if we are the prevailing ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And the sorcerers came to Pharaoh, saying, 'We shall surely have a wage, if we should be the victors?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the wizards came to Pharaoh, saying: Surely there will be a reward for us if we are victors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: And the magicians came to Pharaoh and asked, "Shall we have a reward, if we should prevail?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the magicians came unto Fir'awn. They said: surely there is for us a reward if we are the overcomers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, ‘We shall indeed have a reward if we were to be the victors?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So there came the sorcerers to Pharaoh: They said, "of course we shall have a (suitable) reward if we win!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And so the sorcerers came to Fir'aun (Pharaoh). They said: "Indeed there will be a (good) reward for us if we are the victors."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The sorcerers came to Pharaoh. They said: 'Shall we be rewarded if we are the winners'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The magicians came to Pharaoh, and said, “Surely there is a reward for us, if we are the victors.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:113] And the sorcerers came to Pharaoh, saying, ‘Surely (a-inna: read pronouncing both hamzas, or by not   pronouncing the second one, but inserting an alif between the two in both cases) there will be a wage for us if we are the victors?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the wizards) who were 70 in number (came to Pharaoh, saying) to Pharaoh: (Surely there will be a reward for us) you will give us a gift (if we are victors) against Moses.
